txt.en: 'I believe you may find what you seek there!'
'We have set out on one last, great adventure to search for the lost heirlooms of our forefathers.'
'Do you accept my offer?'
'But what of [placeholder] and the two Kámbrada with whom you ride?'
'I do not know how far the rift continues into Winterstith, but tread cautiously!'
'I think we have seen enough, Dori.'
Instance: Scars of Battle
'The great cold-drake is gone! That is all we need to know.'
'I hear footfalls ahead. Hold.'
'Dori! [placeholder] has caught up to us!'
'Perhaps Karazgar has finished our task for us! After all, he is a dutiful collector of dragons' bones!'
'Kámbrada? I do not understand. Do you speak of Náth and Dréri?'
'Yes, the Stout-axes! Filthy boar-whiskered dwarves!'
'Lickspittles of the Witch-king!'
'Silence!'
'It is true that old wounds still linger between the Kámbrada and the Zhélruka.'
'Our peoples once warred over the wealth of the Ered Cernin, but that was long ago.'
'Let us return to the others. There will be time enough to tell them what we have learned!'
'All that remains of the Kámbrada is a line thin of blood and beard.'
'DNT'
'We are too few in number to hunt the great cold-drake, and too far from Erebor to deliver a warning.'
'They are no enemies of mine.'
'Or perhaps Vethúg devoured him whole. Until we have found Nori, it matters not.'
'Is that so? You have spoken much, but still we know nothing of you.'
'Very well. I am Ingór, son of Vékun II, and brother to King Ótek VII.'
'DNT - SPEW DRAMA AND END INSTANCE'
'You are fortunate, Ingór, son of Vékun that I have not judged you by the harsh words of your companions.'
'Were that so, I would be forced to reject your offer... as any proud dwarf would!'
'I accept your offer, Ingór, son of Vékun. Let us ride to Skarháld!'
'What are we to do? The King under the Mountain must hear of this!'
'What have we here?'
'Perhaps that is true, Glóin... but we will wait until [placeholder] has had a look at this mess.'
'Three old Longbeards... and you, [placeholder]! I never forget a face.'
'It was the will of my father before he died that Dómekh be reclaimed.'
'Let us speak not of faces, but of names!'
'That is my charge.'
'Who are you and who are these Longbeards? What business have you in the Grey Mountains?'
'It is a noble one, Ingór. May you find what you seek!'
'As for my companions and me, I think it best that we continue on our journey.'
'I am Dori, and these are my companions Glóin, Bofur, and [placeholder].'
'Do you plan to travel by the dark road? Even now, the Men Angrún is fraught with peril.'
'You speak true. We are old dwarves... nothing more.'
'For nothing in return, I can give you safe passage to the old Longbeard fortress of Skarháld.'
'Speak for yourself, Dori.'
